Replies.Author: Chris Lee
Replies.Content:
I suppose I wasn’t really there either, seeing as it was done by the time I got out of class, but apparently all that was shown was an abridged version of all of the AMV Hells (save for 0). I usually don’t watch AMVs (for the same reason I don’t read fanfiction), but I do run into a good one here and there by recommendation.

Most well-made AMV I’ve seen in recent memory is this one ( [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GQtr4VPfiRA](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GQtr4VPfiRA)), recommended to me by a friend who is a huge fan of Eureka Seven.

Other than that, hope everyone does well on finals, and hope to see everyone next semester. I’ll make sure to put something up here at some point during break ^\_^

Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content:
I’ve got bad news, Grant. At the end of the showing, we played the first episode of Yosuga no Sora.

Actually, that never happened.

Replies.Author: steve
Replies.Content:
Don’t deny it Gene. The awesome that is Yosuga no Sora is overpowering.

EVEN IF IT WAS ON VLC LOL

Replies.Author: Chris Lee
Replies.Content: Oh yeah, almost forgot about that episode of Yosuga no Sora that wasn’t shown. Definitely some really good stuff you didn’t miss.
